On stream: the default screenshot are jpg.

On offline playing: ... please make it jpg. (Or at least given option for it)

It really save the Earth!

1) You save bandwidth of internet.

2) You save electricity for the 'entire link from upload to download, and view from countless times from countless viewer on countless forum/post/link etc.)

3) You save your own times. You save the others times.

Give me a solid reason why it must be in PNG!

jpg format introduces blocky artifacts to the image. png images preserve much more detail.

Here's a detail from Rowsdower's picture

png:

jpg:

Besides, a single YouTube video takes up more internet bandwidth than whole album of these pictures.

Edited September 12, 2014 by Kasuha

Heavily seconding Sirine's suggestion.

Sure, keep the option to do it in png if we want to. But don't make it compulsory. Having to manually convert everything to jpeg is a major pain in the arse.

Having to manually convert everything to jpeg is a major pain in the arse.

You don't have to. If you upload your images to imgur, all scaled versions come out as jpg.

Besides, there are powerful batch convertors such as irfan view or FastStone.
This is a joke right? Right? Please let me right

There is no significant reason to demand jpg over png that I can reasonably think of.

The "saving the earth" concern is so tiny as to be literally negligible, as are the electricity and time concerns. PNGs are not significantly larger than a JPG, and are lossless.

I literally cannot see why this is a concern at all.

There is no significant reason to demand jpg over png that I can reasonably think of.

The "saving the earth" concern is so tiny as to be literally negligible, as are the electricity and time concerns. PNGs are not significantly larger than a JPG, and are lossless.

I literally cannot see why this is a concern at all.

The JPEGs I've been posting are about 1/10th the size of the default PNGs, actually (about 50-200KB vs 500-1,500KB). And I'm using them because I was directly asked to do so; even today, not everyone has broadband.

What does it cost anyone to let the player choose their default screenshot format? The game can obviously do it, as the Steam situation demonstrates. Sure, the "save the Earth" factor is hyperbole, but download times on dodgy connections are a real issue (for others, not me personally; my broadband copes fine either way).

you can be happy that the game doesn't produce bmps as many other games do and that the lag produced by writing a png is minimal, compared to other formats. This is really a first world problem.

If you want to save space, then do a batch-convert of your screenshots folder, hundreds of free applications support that.

Sure, give the people the option, but then i want the option to tiff, tga,raw,exr etc. etc. and an option for a z-depth picture so i can create better DOF effects in postprocessing.

Edited September 12, 2014 by ximrm
I second (or third, whatever) this. F1 does a screenshot. Alt-F1 can do a JPG screenshot. Nobody who wants PNGs gets hurt and everybody who wants JPGs gets to skip a step.

I agree that adding an option to save the screenshot as jpg would not hurt anyone. I don't see it as a high priority for developers, though.

Saving the Earth is really no concern here, saving your own upload time and perhaps data transfer fees definitely are.

Till there is such option, I suggest to use one of batch image format converters. They're all reasonably simple to use, you can even choose level of compresion/image quality loss and you can do it for entire albums. It is also possible to set up a batch/shell script that will convert your images using set quality settings through simple drag&drop.

PNG forever! Jpeg needs to die as a screenshot format, IMO.

Now, if we could press a key to make a five- or ten-second animated .gif automagically...

PNG forever! Jpeg needs to die as a screenshot format, IMO.

Now, if we could press a key to make a five- or ten-second animated .gif automagically...

Jpeg needs to die but it has damn long roots. Pity jpeg2000 did not spread enough, much better format IMO.

People who make animated gifs from videos should be prosecuted.

People who make animated gifs from videos should be prosecuted.

For short clips, .gif is superior IMO as loading a player would likely take longer than the whole video length. For anything longer than a handful of seconds you have my agreement.

For short clips, .gif is superior IMO as loading a player would likely take longer than the whole video length. For anything longer than a handful of seconds you have my agreement.

It's not about seconds. Majority of videogifs take way more space than a simple player would.

I just tried to find a web video player and it takes up about 300 kB. Few animated gifs are smaller than that.

I'm sure that there are small, lightweight players available, but the majority of video content out there seems to go to youtube, whose player is not so lightweight. You're definitely right about animated gifs getting obnoxiously large quickly, which is why I would limit the time and likely the resolution as well.

Anyway, this is a bit off topic so I'm inclined to agree to disagree about it.

I'm not really disagreeing with you, I think. The fact that nobody really cares about animated gifs is IMO nice evidence of how cheap the bandwidth today really is. There are multiple animated picture formats available providing smaller file size and greater image quality than gifs but none of them is supported by all major browsers.
Luckily lots of gif are now being converted to HTML5 through sites like gfycat. Saves on size and is more versatile.

webm is the future, for example: yum

they even have optional sound if that feature is enabled on whatever site the image is from.

They offer many more features compared to what devs would implement in the forseeable future, and allows squad to continue work on other aspects of the game. So why demand Squad do a rework of something that already is available for free?

I myself have used a few programs for this since BF2 came out, where taking a screenshot caused a 1/2sec stutter that got me killed too often. Since then Ive moved onto this one:

http://getgreenshot.org/

I havnt tried the imgur plugins or anything but it has what I (and you) want: selectable output types, lag free capture, and rapid fire captures. And of course I love open-source freeware.
